deIdi2b2.TEXT:
Record date: 2075-01-22
Internal Medicine Intern Admission Note
PATIENT: ITO, WENDY MRN: 152 47 20 ADMIT DATE: 1/21/2075 TIME: 6pm ATTENDING: Dr Gerry Baldwin and Dr. Grace Jewell PCP: Dr. Noah Quintin-Mcclure Poinciana, 030-624-6793 CONTACT: Verner Ito, (215)638-3640 or (365)775-4811 Son Gilberto Ito 877-274-0509, Son Code status: Full Code (discussed with patient and family) Source: Patient, patient record
CC: HTN and SOB
HPI: Ms. Iot is a 69-year-old female with a history of CHF (EF 40%, no home O2), DM type 2, HTN, nephrotic syndrome, and 1/8/2075 R humerus ORIF presenting from Crest Nursing Home with SOB and HTN. She was discharged from NGH to rehab on 1/8/2075 after ORIF of a right humeral fracture. She feels that she has been doing fairly at rehab. On the evening prior to admission, however, she had some anxiety that resolved after receiving Ativan from her nurse. She then was able to fall asleep but woke-up at 2AM with diaphoresis and SOB. She denied chest pain. She was attended to and her BP was 220/117. She was given 2 SL NTG, O2, and Lasix, after which her SOB somewhat improved but her HTN continued. She also complains of a chronic cough that is productive of white/yellow sputum. She denies missed medications, changes in diet, adding salt to meals (although she is at rehab and her diet order is unclear). At this time, she denies CP, SOB.
ED COURSE: Vitals upon arrival to the ED were T 98.9 HR 114 BP 225/125 RR 32 02 Sat 84% RA. Exam was notable for tachycardia, rales at the apices, use of accessory muscles, and LE edema. Labs were notable for elevated WBC and BNP, non-infected U/A, and evidence of pulmonary edema on CXR. She received Lasix 40mg IV X2, nitoglycerin, Nitropaste,ASA 81mg, Metformin 500, Simvastatin 40, Losartan 50, Lisinopril 40, Prozac 20, Calcium carbonate, and Lopressor 25. She produced 700 cc urine. Upon d/c from the ED, BP was 157/72 and O2 sat was 100% on 2L. LENIs were pending.
ROS General: Positive for diaphoresis and fatigue. no weight loss or gain; no fevers, chills, syncope HEENT: no visual changes, no hearing changes; no neck pain Pulmonary: no wheezing, no hemoptysis Cardiac: Positive for orthopnea. Uses 2 pillow. no chest pain, no palpitations. No PND. Gastrointestinal: Positive for constipation. no nausea, vomiting, diarrhea; no jaundice; no abd pain, no GIB Genitourinary: Positive for inc urinary freq (chronic) but no dysuria, hesitancy, no incontinence; no hematuria Extremity: lower extremity edema Neurology: no HA, no photophobia, no changes in strength/sensation; no numbness or tingling; no seizure activity
MEDICAL HISTORY 1. Diabetes mellitus type 2: Last a1c was 7.90 (10/2074), Last Urine Microalb 283.0 (10/2074) - C/b renal failure, h/o diabetic foot ulcer 2. Hypertension 3. Hyperlipidemia 4. Ischemic CMP -- TTE (3/74) showed EF 40%, LV wall dysfunction -- Adenosine MIBI (3/74): fixed anterior/inferior defects and no reversible ischemia or EKG changes 5. Renal failure/Proteinuria: longstanding nephrotic range proteinuria has persisted despite ACE/ARB. Raised concerns about alternate process in addition to DN. Was biopsied on 11/27--biopsy showed nodular diabetid glomerulosclerosis -- Baseline Cr 0.7 to 0.9 6. Traumatic brain injury s/p MV in 9/2070. 7. H/O L Breast cancer: 00664-- T2 N0 MX invasive ductal carcinoma s/p lumpectomy, wide excision, postop XRT -- LVI-, margins -, ER+PR+, HER 2/neu- 8. Left carotid endarderectomy 9. Left upper lobe lung nodule 10. Comminuted impacted R humerus surgical neck fx s/p mechanical fall on 12/19 11. Depression 12. Anxiety 13. Insomnia 14. Onychomycosis
MEDICATIONS ON ADMISSION: 1. Acetaminophen W/Codeine 30mg (Tylenol #3 ) 1 TAB PO Q6H prn 2. Magnesium Hydroxide (Milk Of Magnesia) 30 ML PO QD prn constipation 3. Bisacodyl 5 MG PO QD prn constipation 4. Multivitamins (Mvi) 1 TAB PO QD 5. Docusate Sodium (Colace) 200 mg PO QD prn constipation 6. Acetylsalicylic Acid (Asa) 81 MG PO QD 7. Anastrozole (Arimidex) 1 MG PO QD 8. Atenololl 50 MG PO QD 9. Calcium Carbonate 1250 Mg (500 Mg Elem Ca) 2 TAB PO TID 10. Fluoxetine Hcl 40 MG PO QD 11. Fosamax (Alendronate) PO QWEEK 12. Hydrochlorothiazide (Hctz) 25 MG PO QD 13. Lisinoprill 40 MG PO QD 14. Losartan 50 MG PO BID 15. Metformin 500 MG PO one tab qAM, 1 qNOON, 2 tabs in evening. 16. Simvastatin 40 MG PO QHS 17. Glipizide (Glucotrol) 5 MG PO BID BEFORE BREAKFAST AND BEFORE SUPPER 18. Acetaminophen 650 MG PO Q4H prn 19. Lorazepam 1 MG PO Q12H
ALLERGIES: NKDA
FAMILY HISTORY Mother: CHF Father: Prostate and colon cancer Siblings: none
SOCIAL HISTORY The patient lives in Poinciana alone but has been in rehab for her humeral fracture. She plans to return home. 5 sons. Retired Electrical Contractor Tobacco: Quit 1/8/2075. 1PPD since teens Alcohol: None Illicit drugs: The patient denies past and present use of illicit drugs.
PHYSICAL EXAM VITALS: Tcurrent: 97.3 HR: 62 BP: 155/67 RR: 16 O2Sat: 92% 4L NC GEN’L NAD, Non-toxic appearing, AO x 3 HEENT NCAT. PEERLA. EOMI. NECK Supple, no thyromegaly or LAD. Carotids are 2+ bilaterally without bruits. JVP 10cm HEART RRR. Normal S1, S2. No m/r/g LUNG Rhonchi and crackles at bases bilat. No wheeze. BACK Normal spine curvature. No paraspinal tenderness. No CVA tenderness. ABD: Soft, non-tender, non-distended. Active BS. EXT WWP distally. 2+ pitting edema to thighs. NEURO: Alert. Oriented to person, place, time. CN II-XII grossly intact. Sensation grossly intact to light touch and vibration.
CHEMISTRIES 21-Jan-2075 03:59 Plasma Sodium 136 Plasma Potassium 4.3 Plasma Chloride 98 L Plasma Carbon Dioxide 32.4 H Calcium 9.4 Phosphorus 3.9 Magnesium 2.2 H Plasma Urea Nitrogen 20 Plasma Creatinine 0.9 Plasma Glucose 297 H NT-proBNP 8924 H 3900 in 3/2074
CARDIAC ENZYMES 21-Jan-2075 04:33 and 11:00 AM Creatine Kinase Isoenzymes NEGATIVE x2 at 4AM and 11AM Troponin-I NEGATIVE X2 at 4AM and 11AM HEMATOLOGY 21-Jan-2075 03:59 WBC 21.3 H HCT 41.9 HGB 13.0 RBC 4.36 PLT 659 H MCV 96 MCH 29.9 MCHC 31.1 RDW 12.6 Superstat PT 11.7 Superstat PT-INR 1.0 Superstat APTT 24.4 Diff Method Auto Poly 80 H Lymphs 13 L Monos 4 EOS 2 Basos 1 Absolute Neuts 16.96 H Absolute Lymphs 2.83 Absolute Monos 0.89 H Absolute EOS 0.48 H Absolute Basos 0.12 Aniso None Hypo 1+ H Macrocytes None Microcytes None
URINALYSIS 21-Jan-2075 05:37 UA-Color Yellow UA-Turbidity Clear UA-Specific Gravity 1.020 UA-pH 7.0 UA-WBC Screen NEGATIVE UA-Nitrite NEGATIVE UA-Glucose Trace UA-Ketones NEGATIVE Urobilinogen NEGATIVE Bili NEGATIVE UA-Occult Blood 2+ UA-SED-RBC 20-50 UA-SED-WBC 0-2 UA-SED-Bacteria NEGATIVE Hyaline Cast 3-5 Squamous Cells NEGATIVE UA-Albumin 3+
MICROBIOLOGY: None
RADIOLOGY 1. CXR: Lungs: The lungs are satisfactorily inflated. There is increasing prominence of the interstitium and peribronchial cuffing when compared to the prior study consistent with interval development of CHF. Surgical clips are again noted projected over the left lower hemithorax. No definite focal consolidation is demonstrated. Pleura: There is no pneumothorax. The hemidiaphragms are very slightly less distinct than on the comparison study. This could be related to the onset of parenchymal changes of CHF, but could also be related to a small amount of pleural fluid. IMPRESSION: Findings consistent with CHF.
2. Bilateral LENIs: NO EVIDENCE OF FEMORAL OR POPLITEAL DEEP VENOUS THROMBOSIS OF EITHER LEG.
EKG: Normal sinus rhythm at 95. Normal axis. Normal PR, QRS, QT intervals. No ST elevations or depressions. ? Q waves in v1, v2, v3 but also may be upslopes before the downslops. However new since 12/12/2074
ASSESSMENT & PLAN
Mrs. Ito is a 69F with a history of CHF (EF 40%, no home O2), DM type 2, HTN, nephritic syndrome, and 1/15/2075 R humerus ORIF presenting from Crest Nursing Home with SOB and HTN. Her exam and imaging is consistent with pulmonary edema, as she has had in the past. The precipitant of her flash pulmonary edema is less clear, however. She describes waking up acutely short of breath and was found to be profoundly hypertensive. It is possible that HTN 2/2 a change in her diet or fluid intake at rehab, ischemia, increases renin-aldo, or other cause led to flash pulmonary edema. Conversely, however, CHF may have precipitated her HTN.
1. Shortness of breath/CHF: Evidence of volume overload by exam and imaging. PE also on the differential but seems less likely given improvement of resp status, negative LENIs. -- Lasix 40mg IV now -- Strict I+O -- Daily weights -- F/up PA/Lat -- Continuous O2 sat monitor;Telemetry, cardiac monitor -- f/up cardiac enzymes -- ASA 325 qd -- Will give Lopressor 25 Q8 and Captopril 50 Q8 for now but may need to reconsider the BB if CHF less compensated. -- Albuterol and atrovent for possible COPD component given tobacco history -- Consider TTE in AM -- Consider PFTs
2. Leukocytosis: Infection vs stress response. Patient presents with elevated WBC with 80% polys. Infectious work-up has included U/A that is negative for infection. CXR does not show evidence of focal consolidation, however may be obscured by pulmonary edema. Mental status at baseline. I am suspicious for PNA given her report of productive cough howeve do not feel pressed to treat at this time as she is afeb. -- Cont to follow fever curve and WBC -- F/up PA/Lat -- Consider addition of abx for HAP if fever, PA/lat concerning -- F/up Blood cultures and sputum cultures -- F/up c diff
3. Hypertension: Home HTN regimen is Atenolol 50mg QD, HCTZ 25 qday, Lisinopril 40 qday, Losartan 50 BID -- Start Captoril 50 mg Q8 and Lopressor 25 q8 and titrate up as needed fo tight BP control -- Cardiac monitor
4. DM type 2: Home regimen is Metformin/Glucotrol. -- D/c oral agents and start Insulin SS w BID BS
5. Hematuria/Proteinuria on U/A: Consisent with prior U/A
6. Breast CA: Cont Arimidex (hormone tx)
7. HL: Cont statin
8. Depression: Cont Prozac
9. Tobacco use: Cont Chantix 0.5 mg PO QDay
10. Anxiety: Ativan PRN at home.
11. FEN: Low chol, low sat fat, ADA diet with no added salt. Cont Vit D/ Calcium
12. PROPHYLAXIS: GI: Not indicated DVT: Heparin 5000 Units SC BID BOWEL: Colace/Senna PRN
13. CODE STATUS: Full Code (Discussed with patient)
__________________________________ Jocelyn T Issa MD, Mphil Pager #61158
